When these components are used in the views registered by the plugin, due to the nature of portals, they are inserted outside of the plugin view slot (i.e., the plugin's
). Additionally, because of the isolation of the

For components like Dialog and Overlay in

Since React's synthetic events are based on event delegation and rely on the root node of the DOM tree, in some components (such as

), it may be impossible to capture events bubbled up from their child components (the exact reason is still under investigation). This can cause event handlers for child components of these components to fail. It is recommended to use
to manually specify the root node delegated for events to the above-mentioned container component, for example:
